Description: This was the dream guitar I had spec'ed out for G&L to build, and they knocked it out of the park!!!So why am I selling it??? Simply because I've decided that I I would rather have had a fixed bridge since I don't use a term other than Bigsby style. So a standard tremolo was something I wanted, and I've decided that it's just not for me. Which is sad because this is unreal guitar!!! Here is copy of the actual order, and this should help you to see what was requested via my order through the legendary Dave's Guitar Shop in WI. Total cost of order was roughly around $2,200 when purchase a few months back. This guitar has less than one hour of playing time on it, and has never left the house, and includes the hard shell case that was provided by G&L. G&L Build - Desired Specs ElectronicsDual Humbuckers with chrome cap and cream bindingNeck Pickup: Suhr ThornbuckerBridge Pickup: Suhr Thornbucker+5 way pickup selector - Configuration of pickup selector belowNeck - Neck in Parallel - Both - Bridge in Parallel - BridgeNo coil splitting and no pull pots for pickup settings BodyASAT with both forearm and belly contourColoring - Transparent OrangeNatural bindingBridge - G&L Trem - ChromeVolume & Tone controls - The short-old-school rounded or dome style top look NeckRosewood neckNon-gloss finish - Looking for a more natural or satin clear finishNon-painted headstock - Natural coloringAged wood looking neckTuners - lockingG&L logo onlyAbalone Face DotsStainless steel fretsFret size based off my current ASAT - Spec sheet shows them as Medium Jumbo - Serial number CLF065514Neck dimensions based off my current ASAT - Spec sheet shows them as Medium Jumbo - Serial number CLF065514Neck profile based on the spec sheet for Serial number CLF065514#1 Classic C - 1 ⅝” Nut Width, 12” Radius.830” depth at first fret, .960” depth at 12th fret (+/- .015” tolerance upon completion) Other general specs if not mentioned or clear aboveStrings and guitar setup for D’Addario NYXL guitar strings 9|42All hardware chrome Final build notes for Dave’s Guitar TechPlease have trem setup so that I can get a full step and a half (3 frets up) or just over that on the G-String when pulling up on the tremPlease use D’Addario NYXL guitar strings 9|42 for StringsPlease install the Tremol-No - I have spoken with the manufacture, and he is encouraging the tech to call in regards to the alteration that must be performed on the G&L Trem that does not exist on a Fenderand he has offered to do a quick video call if that helps as wellPlease install the Suhr pickups - Thornbucker in the neck and Thornbuck Plus in the bridge - Please balance their height so that we have a good volume balance when switching between the twoPlease install the 5 way pickup selector with the following positions1 - Bridge (standard)2 - Bridge (parallel)3 - Both pickups (standard)4 - Neck (parallel)5 - Neck (standard)Install the “cream-colored” pickup bezels and pickup selector top
Title: G&L ASAT - One of a kind build with Suhr Thornbucker pickups and Tremol-No
